Welcome to the PICUP upper-level workshop!

An outline of the workshop:

1. Introduction to PICUP

Introduction to PICUP slides (Marie Lopez del Puerto’s talk)

Some resources:

Join PICUP

PICUP Slack channel

PICUP website

2. Group-work: simulating pendula

After the introduction, we have in mind that you all will spend a little time on an exercise involving a computer simulation of a pendulum, and either study the effects of damping and driving (on the same page) or look at how computational physics can be used to teach early-career students the basics of perturbation theory through the nonlinearities in the pendulum.

3. Showcase of upper-division projects

4. Authoring exercise sets

Have a nifty exercise that you do with your students that you’d like to post to the PICUP exercise set collection? We’ll tell you how to submit it for publication.
